entry.def: A divot is a small piece of grass and earth which is dug out accidentally, for example by a golf club.

means.word_mean: 1. (golf) the cavity left when a piece of turf is cut from the ground by the club head in making a stroke;

sentences.sentence: "it was a good drive but the ball ended up in a divot"

means.word_mean: 2. a piece of turf dug out of a lawn or fairway (by an animals hooves or a golf club)
